humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there is only one sentinel lymph node that is positive for isolated tumor cells, which is defined as pN0(i+)(sn). This is equivalent to the N0 stage as it indicates no metastases in regional lymph nodes. The new rule 11 supports this finding, which states that N0 can indicate that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has isolated tumor cells present in one out of three sentinel lymph nodes (AJCC pN0(i+)(sn)), which is classified as N0 according to the AJCC cancer staging system. The substaging information (i+) can be ignored for this question.
